summary: Build a food ordering app for a cloud kitchen called "Moms Kitchen".
architectural_notes: Menu items should include an availability flag (available/unavailable) that the UI uses to prevent ordering unavailable dishes.
known_issues: Deployed application is not working (user reports the app is broken).

existing_features.title: Create a customer-facing web app for the cloud kitchen named "Moms Kitchen" that lets users browse the menu, add items to a cart, and place a food order.
Seed the application with a starter menu for "Moms Kitchen" that is available on first load (no admin UI required).
Create key customer screens: Menu (browse), Cart (review/edit), Checkout (customer details), Order Confirmation (order summary), and Order Lookup (enter order ID to view status/details).
Use React Query for backend data fetching/mutations (menu fetch, place order, lookup order), with loading/error states for each operation.
Define and apply a consistent visual theme for "Moms Kitchen" (distinct style, colors, typography, and layout) across all pages using Tailwind, without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Add generated static brand assets and render them in the UI from the frontend public assets directory (no backend image serving).
Fix frontend handling of Motoko Candid variant types for OrderStatus so order tracking and confirmation pages do not crash and display a correct, human-readable status label.
Add a clear user-facing error state when the frontend cannot reach or initialize the backend actor, including a retry affordance, so the app does not appear blank or broken.
Update the Menu page UI to reflect availability: show a clear “Unavailable” state for unavailable dishes and prevent adding unavailable dishes to the cart.

Add a menu management UI in the app that lets a user add new dishes and mark dishes available/unavailable from the menu management screen, using React Query mutations and showing loading/error states.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a cloud-kitchen food ordering app for "Moms Kitchen" (browse menu and place orders).
Implement backend canister data models and APIs for menu items and orders, including persistence across canister upgrades using stable state.
Ensure the backend canister always has a non-empty starter menu on first load so the Menu page displays items without requiring any user action.
Add a menu management option to let an admin/owner add new dishes (create menu items) from the app UI.
Support marking menu items as available/unavailable and reflect this in the customer menu (e.g., disable ordering or hide unavailable items).
Create and include a cute "Mom's Kitchen" logo as a static brand asset and render it in the UI.
Extend the backend MenuItem model to include an availability flag, and expose it via getMenu so the frontend can tell whether each dish is available or unavailable.
Add backend APIs to (1) create a new dish (menu item) and (2) toggle/set a dish as available or unavailable.
